topic.title: How to Perform Common Editing Tasks

keywords.indexterm: WebApp enable change trackingedit attributesedit MathML equations

ol.li: Tap or click to move the caret into the selected document area.
Type the text using the keyboard
Tap or click to move the caret at the split position.
Press Enter on the keyboard to display the Content Completion Assistant. Choose Split p from the list of proposals.

section.title: Enter a new XML element, or to surround the selection in an XML element

ol.li: Tap or click to move the caret into the selected document area, or make a text selection.
Tap or press Enter to open the Content Completion Assistant.
Select the element name.
Tap or click the Track Changes button from the Review toolbar to enable or disable this feature.
Tap or click the Menu button from the upper right side corner, or swipe from right to left. A side panel is displayed.
Press the Attributes tab. The attributes side panel is displayed. You can also press Ctrl+E to change the focus to the Attributes tab and it automatically selects the first attribute in the list.

If the attribute is present in the attributes table (it already has a value), you can change its value by tapping/clicking its value. You can also use Tab or Shift+Tab to cycle through the available attributes and the Enter key to select and modify attribute values.
If the attribute is not present, press the Add Attribute button and tap or click the attribute to set its value.
Tap or click the Menu button from the upper right side corner, or swipe from right to left. A side panel is displayed.
Press the Attributes tab. The attributes side panel is displayed.
Find the attribute in the table and press or tap its value.
Click the Delete button (or use the Delete key) .

section.title: Save a modified XML document
section.p: To save your changes, tap or click the Save button from the upper toolbar. Note that the open and save operations depend on the integration of the with a CMS or other storage mechanism.

ol.li: Tap or click the Find/Replace button from the upper toolbar, or the Rind/Replace tab.
The Find/Replace side panel is open. Type the text you want to find in the Search for input box and press the Find button in the left side of that same input box.
All matches are highlighted, and the first one is selected. To advance to the next match, press the Find button again.
To replace content, type the new text in the Replace with input box. To replace the current match, press the Replace button. To replace all matches, press the Replace all button.
Click the equation to open an editing dialog box.
Edit the XML source of the equation.
Press OK to finish the editing process.
